channel.title: How to organise commands

item.title: How to organise commands
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:2, topic:21342”]Um… still, the computer would have to loop through that whole thing each time it needed to find a specific command. Wouldnt it be better to put them all in seperate files?

if(playerRights==3){
ownerCommands.command();
} … etc?[/quote]
no

item.title: How to organise commands
item.dc:creator: @flamed_fury1 flamed fury1
item.description:
@flamed_fury1 wrote:

This is a way to organise your commands into player rights groups.
Very simple

Just set them out like this:

[code]//START OF CUSTOM COMMANDS

public void customCommand(String command) {
actionAmount++;

//START OF OWNER COMMANDS
if (playerRights >= 3) {

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofsecondcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofthirdcommand")) {
	*command code* }

//START OF ADMIN COMMANDS
if (playerRights >= 2) {

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofsecondcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofthirdcommand")) {
	*command code* }

//START OF MOD COMMANDS
if (playerRights >= 1) {

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofsecondcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofthirdcommand")) {
	*command code* }

//START OF NORMAL COMMANDS
if (playerRights >= 0) {

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofsecondcommand")) {
	*command code* }
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nameofthirdcommand")) {
	*command code* }[/code]

Read full topic
